name: Faye Ahzburjn
text: My husband has had issues with erroneous fees being taken out of his account. I introduced my husband to BBVA Compass bank because I was a satisfied long time account holder, but I've since regretted advising him, as a foreign national, to open an account there. We have made multiple visits to attempt to have correct information on his account and discuss the "extended overdraft fee" being taken from his account on the same day his paycheck is directly deposited. Chris Ballard is the one we spoke with on our last visit, Friday. We waited patiently for someone and he came in from outdoors and invited us in the office. He was shaking and trembling and seemed agitated before we even got down to business.  The meeting ended with him yelling and demanding that I be quiet and let him finish talking. At this point I had already witnessed him becoming increasingly agitated and shaking but with him becoming red in the face and yelling, we decided to leave with plans on closing both our accounts In the near future.

text: Best bank in Alabama!

name: Drew Poole
text: A nice hometown bank in Madison. The people there make banking personal. And that's is why I continue to go there. They know and remember me. Banking isn't as cold as it is a RSFC and I can get in and out quickly. They always take them time to answer my questions with a smile and I get that down home feeling. Love these folks.

name: Sasha Walls
text: Premier Bank of the South is like banking is supposed to be. The staff are absolutely wonderful. I have both my business account and personal accounts here. I am so happy with how they conduct business.  Decisions are based on alot more than just numbers, they get to know the account holders as people.

name: Jeff Cook
text: I went into the branch with 1 other guy and he was greeted with the pleasantries of southern charm, upsold on a credit card offer that he didn’t take advantage of, asked what denominations he wanted to receive his withdrawal in and wished a enjoyable time on Dauphin Island; I on the other wasn’t greeted, upsold, asked if I needed anything else or extended well wishes. The experience felt like an episode of “Them”! The 50’s called and they want there ism’s back. Do better! Money is green and customer service is key. I won’t be back to this branch.

name: charles nicholas
text: The ladies are real nice and work with you ,much appreciated.

name: Rainy Day
text: Great bank with friendly staff.

name: Robbie Malone
text: Westside location is the best.

name: dwn
text: Regions system terrible, but it could always be worse. I'm waiting on hold for 15+ minutes right now to tell them they put too much money in my account - apparently it will show the correct amount by tomorrow, the rep says. How much money is in your account? Who knows? Yesterday I taught a manager how to find my account number on the website after he was obliquely rude. I've been with Regions (then AmSouth) since I was 11 years old, and the services offerred are still awful. They gotta build all those buildings somehow, I guess.

name: Tamy Joseph
text: If i could give all regions less than half a star. I would. Save yourself and stay far from this bank, go to redstone or pnc or even Bank of America for Gods sake. They charge to cash checks, then if you cash a check after a certain time they don’t let you access the money till more than 24 hrs later which is a dumbass system. Just avoid them, run far from regions and don’t turn back.

name: Michael
text: They tried to push a financial advisor when I deposited a check. Annoying.

name: Ted Cannon
text: They charge to cash their own customer's checks! I've mentioned it to Regions customers and they don't realize Regions does that. Seems deceitful to me.

name: Roni MacAndrew
text: Good place for banking needs

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text: My grandmother used them for years. Did what she needed

name: Shaquille Wesson
text: Seek and day DMD

name: Roland Vance
text: Informed and candid, you just cannot get any better than this!

name: Keila Tzoyohua
text: Came to regions on Mon the Jan 11 the 2021. At 12. I needed to add my husband to my account that I just opened a few weeks ago. He took his lunch to get this done. As we walked it there was a lady in the first bankers office space talking up a storm with a couple of men in her cubical. We were attended quickly be a nice lady with short hair and glasses that was in the front main office. We forgot my husbands passport so we had to go back home and come back. We came back and the lady in the cubical was still having a conversation with the men about things that had nothing to do with banking. We came to sit once again and wait. The lady that attended us the first time with with another couple assisting them. She finished with them and the assisted another couple that must of been here earlier and came back with a stack of paper work and she helped them quickly. We still sat here waiting. It is exactly 1:35pm and we still have not been attended and the lady in the first cubical is still working with the old men that came to just open a simple account. (I could here there conversation) even as she asked for his information which was heard very well. (There is not much sound proofing). It’s been and hour and a half, she is still with the men. When I opened my account it took the lady but 20-30 at the most to get everything done. This is ridicules!! I worked at Wells Fargo bank in Jacksonville as a teller in 2015 and we never had a banker take that long with a costumer!! That banker needs a reality check. She is short with long black hair. 😡😡😡 1:42pm and she still not done!! Seriously!!

resp.text:
Our apologies for the delay, and we're sorry to hear about your extended wait during your visit.
We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We have forwarded your concerns to the appropriate channel. -Trish

name: calab englebert
text: Refused to give cash back on a check I was depositing into my account.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about the situation you have had. Our team would like to review this information and have these details documented. Please send over an email with your phone number to askRegions@regions.com. -Ana

name: Leah Carlisle
text: I had a wonderful experience at the oxford, al regions.  Maria was soo sweet and helpful! 12:41 pm on Aug 8th 2017.

name: Joy Thompson
text: I dealt with numerous banks over the years Regions had been the best.

name: Timothy Holinshed
text: Wish I could set less than 1 star, never have been so humiliated in my life. Had an incident of a fraudulent deposit and lmediately spoke with the fraud team and cooperated with there investigation in every way possible. They froze my account except for deposits and called me to say we're closing your account and didn't even honor checks I had written against my account which had plenty of money to pay them, now I have to go to merchants that I've done business with and make this right. Worst experience I've ever had with a bank.

text: Easy access...right across from Quintard Mall.

text: Can't talk to any one at local bank always a call center..wait time greater than 15 min closing accounts sorry bank..

text: This bank will screw you. They will hang up on the phone if they can't help you. They will lie 😂

name: Tweet 12
text: Thank you Sheila Williams for helping me today . She is super sweet  and welcoming gave me great info and she helped me get my account open today .

resp.text: This is so awesome to hear! We appreciate you sharing your great experience with us! -Trish

text: Great branch, great bank! Our banker, Tanisha Parker, took good care of us and we were able to open a joint account immediately. No hassle, just wonderful customer service. Everyone at that branch treated us very courteously and knowledgeably. Best banking experience ever! Highly recommend. A+

It should not take 45 minutes to get through a drive through line with 4 cars in it! This is not a one time experience, this happens weekly.The employees are rude & slow. text: Had my car refinanced through them and payed it off twice as fast as I would have with finance company we was with. They are friendly and helpful.

name: Kimberly Fox
text: I wish I would have never done business with family security credit union

name: Asiq AL MAHMOOD
text: Best service i ever had

name: Skye Maltbie
text: I can't say enough about this bank. I recommend them to everyone. We were with another bank for years and the first sign of fraudulent charges on my account they refused to do anything about it. After losing close to $2000 we closed our account and went looking for a new bank. WF had the best hours and with a family of 6  and a husband on the road alot, this was very  important. I opened my account with the bank manager. He treated me very well. I opened my account one week and the next week when I went back in to deposit a check, I was greeted by name and even asked about how work was going. In the 7+ I was with my previous bank, noone addressed me by name, more or less asked me about anything personal. It was a nice change. We've been here over 4 years now and I've had zero issue with them. I'll never use another bank.

name: Tommy Morgan
text: I have banked here for years. Personal and business. Very happy with service and employees. Highly recommend.

name: Jennifer Darnell
text: Best banking experience I've ever had. The people here are always helpful and go out of their way to accomplish whatever you need done.

name: Debbie Freeman
text: The Western Union representatives are rude and condescending. On October 26, 2019, I attempted to send $600 to a friend I've known for 10 years in Uganda. She needed some money quickly for a medical procedure. I was told my reason sounded "highly suspicious." I was then reprimanded for sending money in this manner. The manager acknowledged it was common practice for people to illegally send money while shopping for groceries at Walmart. I was humiliated and will share this unpleasant experience with anyone I can.

name: Ron O'Neill
text: Excellent service, and always very helpful!!!

name: Dick Linley
text:
Have often noticed the Woodforest location at Walmart and their hours of operation seemed appealing.  Stopped by and picked up a pamphlet and briefly spoke with an extremely personable young lady, Amber Boroughs.
Researched bank online, along with this particular location and was somewhat bewildered by the negative views posted locally regarding customer service.

Decided to open a 2nd checking account at this facility to actually test performance against my current bank.  Upon my return, Ms.Boroughs efficiently and professionally assisted with the opening of the account.

Thus far I have been quite impressed with Woodforest, debit card transactions and a couple of deposits have performed flawlessly. I really like the almost instant notification of debit card and account activity.  One can choose to be notified even on days when there is zero account activity.

Still assessing the overall performance of the bank prior to totally committing.  But the customer service at the Olive St location has been great.  No waiting in line, my current bank is very similar to visiting the post office, always a line.  The staff has been very courteous, with Ms. Boroughs deserving 5 stars for graciousness and professionalism.

Still grading Woodforest as a whole, but the local staff is top flight.

name: DeAndrea Thompson
text: Absolutely horrible customer service using the banks Western Union service. The woman had a bad attitude from the beginning of the transaction and halfway through the transaction refused to send the money with no explanation. I have never had a teller at a bank be so rude and unhelpful. I was able to go 5 minutes down the road to another Western Union and complete the transaction with zero issues. And the person there did it with a smile.

name: Jasmine Mullet
text: I love it here at the Olive st. Location. They are always so friendly and actually seem to care about what’s going on with my account and my needs. Also, the are extremely efficient. Yeah, you may be waiting in line for a hot minute, but that isn’t all on the workers. People can be very demanding and incompetent. You don’t know what’s going on up there at the counter. Keep up the good job guys!!

name: Russell Perrin
text: I love my ladies at Woodforest.  Intelligent and professional!!

name: George Cvarkov
text: Bank is in Walmart.

name: myFATlife “Vuh-jj” By: Virginia
text:
RACIAL DISCRIMINATION!!!!!!
The only reason they got one star was cause there isn't an option for 0. I visited this place today 4/12/2016 To pick up money from Western Union sent from my soon to be husband's brother. I waited until a women got up off the computer after standing there for approximately three minutes cause I rarely use Western Union and never have here before so I didn't know what to do.  I hand over my paper and Kimberly R. Stone looked over it she didn't even pull up the MTCN, she then asked me "What's this money for?" I said "traveling expenses, My fiance and I are going to visit his family and they're sending us the money from where he's from." SHE DIDN'T EVEN TOUCH THE MOUSE ON THE COMPUTER!!!!  Kimberly R. Stone claimed she couldn't process my transaction. When I asked "Why?" in confusions. She said she suspected Fraud when I asked why she said "Why can't your boyfriend pick it up?" ALTHOUGH IT WAS NONE OF HER BUSINESS SINCE IT WAS IN MY NAME AND I HAD A VALID DRIVERS ID. I told her,  "We had problems with walmart not accepting his passport as a valid id and we didn't want to have any problems since its coming from so far away."  Kimberly R. Stone NEVER TOLD ME WHY SHE THOUGHT IS WAS FRAUD and unethically racially discriminated THIS because she seen it was coming from Saudi Arabia from a guy named Osama( It's the third most popular name for men from 20-56 years old) and rudely embarrassed me in front of another employee and customer. She then made the situation worse by making a sour look on her face and the tone in her voice was VERY hateful My friend's said they heard her gossiping to that employee and the customer after I left, so loudly she could hear and she was going through the checkout isle in front of the bank . She didn't even pull it up on the computer. I just can't believe they wouldn't train their employee's ESPECIALLY one in management about RACIAL DISCRIMINATION. Absolutely astounds me how racism still thrives in the south, you would expect someone in management to put aside their PERSONAL opinions on a situation and DO THEIR JOB PROFESSIONALLY. WHY do you guy's lie on your website about your employee's being professional or giving the highest level of customer service.. Isn't this your motto? " Woodforest Commitment Woodforest is a community bank built upon the needs of the customers we serve. We are committed to earning customer loyalty by offering the highest level of customer service as well as competitive products and services by employees who are fair, responsive, and professional. "

name: Joseph Willingham
text: BEST BANK I HAVE EVER HAD

name: gary patel
text: All employees are rude. They don't care about customer please Walmart do something

name: Matt Taylor
text: I've seen the bad reviews, but in my experience they've been nothing but friendly and helpful!

name: Stephen K
text: Absolutely the nicest and most professional group of people you could imagine doing business with! 6 stars

name: Joseph Rudnicky
text: What kind of bank is only open 2 days a week

name: Lloyd Weaver
text: I have been using this bank for over two years I got the 500 dollar overdraft since me and my wife got are first apartment we had nothing and had to keep using the overdraft pretty often there is a 30 dollar overdraft fee for anything over 1 dollar over witch is fine with me. How ever out of the blue they tuck the overdraft away and told me I have done to many over drafts and I could over use the over draft again in 30 days. OK fine after 30 days I got in a tight spot due to covid19 Palmer Toyota said we could only work every other day to lower the risk of getting covid but I still needed food and gas and rent even if they didn't charge a late fee it still had to be paid but can't overdraft.so after the 30 days the overdraft still is not working they said oh well it's going to be 60 days not 30 nope after 60 days still no overdraft once again I ask them why then I was told oh it's going to be 90 days for a cool down nope still no overdraft so once again I asked why no overdraft and was told oh it's has to have a full 6 months for its cool down. OK FINE! well even after that still no overdraft so again them why and they say I have to resign up for overdraft then it will finally work after 24 hours. Well still no overdraft after 6 days so again I go and ask why no overdraft and now they are telling me I can never have overdraft there again due to how many overdrafts I have made like a year ago. Like I said I needed over draft due to moving in are first apartment we needed everything so yes I used overdraft often they ALWAYS got there 30 dollar overdraft fee and the were always paid back and had a positive balance the following week we just had are first child so it would really be nice to know if I need to use overdraft I could but no giving them 30 dollars is not good enough for this joke of a bank. And also at the time I started a new job at Toyota as a tech so I needed overdraft to help get tools I did not have new apartment first child new job but now no overdraft with no warning and nobody knew at that bank why all I was told was next month next month them clown don't know anything.

name: Manda McGuff
text: My card was compromised and I needed a new card. I got to the branch a few minutes before closing the clerk was the sweetest and stayed passed closing to get me taken care of! Great banking experience for 10 years strong!

name: Bella Carter
text:
NADIA at this location needs a RAISE!!
Running Practices/clinics, my main goal is patient care services & training the right people. This day an age that’s hard to come by. But Nadia, proved GREAT customer services till exist.
My family member & I walked past bank table that had brochures & business cards out. A gentleman came out of office & clearly bank was closed up, so I told him it’s ok, we will come back when they open tomorrow. Here comes Ms. Nadia & another lady coming out from back  & to my surprise she took the initiative to say “don’t worry I’ll stay to help you both.”
15 minutes after they close & 10 minutes later(or more) we both signed up. ThankYou again for the Excellent customer service.

name: Malcolm Moultrie
text: Great Bank, Great employees and great banking Hours!! Your In and out in 5mins time! I would most definitely recommend this Bank to my family and Friends any day!

name: Sally Ann Davis
text: Each visit has always impressed me with their professionalism and friendliness. I would totally recommend this branch to anyone.

name: Sherrie Foster
text: Always very helpful and friendly.

name: LaTonya Vee
text:
Great staff,Excellent customer service....
Celeste was wonderful and handle the issue with my account very promptly.. Thanks Celeste.....

name: Kierra Ealey
text: Im currently here at their branch waiting for someone to assist me but literally no one has come yet and its been 5mins. I've called they're branch number twice since Ive been here and got no answer! Highly unprofessional.

name: Sherrie Foster
text: Always very helpful and friendly.

name: Vivian Delobelle
text: very professional

name: Tammy Williams
text: Absolutely amazing customer service at this branch! Very professional and always greets you with a friendly smile. The Branch Manager is very professional, knowledgeable, helpful and always willing to answer any of my banking questions. The Warrior Branch is my go to with my banking needs.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for the 5 star review, Tammy. We have a great team and we love hearing feedback like yours. Thank you for your banking relationship!

~we care about people

name: Kenny Dyas
text: A little slow at the Drive thru, but that's understandable during this pandemic. Overall, a great little bank with which to do business.

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback, Kenny. We greatly appreciate the 5 star review and your understanding during these unprecedented times.
~we care about people

name: Jason Woodard
text: I had my debit card and check book stolen and the folks at the Warrior branch were extremely helpful and friendly. They helped me create new accounts and made sure that all of my deposits and direct withdrawals were taking care. Can't say enough about them. Its so rare to find great customer service like this anymore.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience with us, Jason. Glad our team was able to help you through this challenging situation. We appreciate your business and look forward to being there whenever a future need arises. ~with us, banking is personal

name: Troop scout
text: Friendly staff usually fast with little wait.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review. ~with us, banking is personal

name: Enrique Gomez
text: Fabulously Awesome Customer Service

name: Micki Streitmatter
text: The people who work here are very friendly and work fast

name: Art Of Valor
text: Fast, efficient and super friendly service!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for the 5 star review, Jay. We appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback. Our team works hard to give you a great experience and your kind words validate all they do.

~we care about people

name: Nikki B
text: Best back I have ever had. No fees on my account for anything what so ever the bank is always immaculate and everyone is so nice and helpful. Also love that service there is fast everytime I go I'm in and out in about 5 minutes

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review! ~with us, banking is personal

name: Carol Calaway
text: Best bank in the area. Love them

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review! ~with us, banking is personal

name: Patsy Pierce
text: best in the area

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review! ~with us, banking is personal

name: Rebekah Jones
text: this place sucks and is always messing up my bank account and they are the hardest to get in contact with when you have an issue do not recommend this bank

resp.text: Hi Rebekah, we are sorry you have had a bad experience. It does not sound like this meets our service standards, and we would like to understand more. Would you email details and your preferred contact method to ma@bibank.com so we may follow up?

name: Richard Hardigree
text: We bank with bank independent in Decatur for several years now. I was in Athens with my family and had a check to deposit. My wife needed to use the restroom and was told no public restrooms. I am shocked that a bank that serves customers on a daily basis does not offer a basic service for its customers. Also very disappointed in the way we spoke too.

resp.text: We're sorry you had a negative experience at our Athens location, Richard! Because of the layout of some offices, including Athens Downtown, public restrooms are not available for security reasons. We're sorry for the inconvenience and the way you were spoken to. If there is anything we can do for you, please reach out to ma@bibank.com.

name: Jc
text: Will only notarize for members of the bank, unless your willing to pay $5.00. Bank had no customers in the building. May have made a customer had they proved they wanted business. Not willing to help the public unless money is involved.

name: Nikki Rochelle
text:
Really unhappy with my service today. I came through the drive through and the woman at the window took my money, gave me my receipt, and said "bye". I was not finished with my transaction so I pushed the call button and she said "do you need something else?".
When I told her a needed a different receipt, she said I would have to wait and she started to cash a check for a guy who pulled up to the next window AFTER I had arrived. Not only was she rude she was not helpful. After the man with the check finished his transaction. The teller came back to me and told me I should just use the app because she is alone and doesn't have any assistance in the office today (but the app is not showing the money deposited). She told me to wait a minute she just had to help this next woman with her transaction and she could assist me. This woman was the car behind the man who cashed the check (so TWO people that arrived after I did). I moved to Alabama from out of state and BB&t Bank came highly recommended to me from a lot of people that I met. I am seriously considering finding a another bank with employees who take customer service seriously, and care about maintaining customer relationships.

name: Domingo Ayala
text: Everyone at this bank is nice until Megan just gave me an awkwardly stare without any explanation and I asked “ ..... What? “ And she didn’t say anything which was beyond weird and unprofessional. I have had never experienced that type of odd behavior. Everyone else is nice and professional.

text: I love everyone at this location and they love my husky always spoil him giving him dog treats at the drive thru Everytime I come through they are all sweet never any issues or problems.

name: Selenophile Xx
text:
I opened my acct at this branch. I am currently living out of state in Wisconsin where there are no BBTs. I was very concerned about having to close my acct.. so I call this branch to see what i needed to do, some lady (yarah I believe) told me there was nothing she could do to help me.. i couldn't do it over the phone/online.. I tell her my situation. And she showed no concern or effort to help me. She told me I HAD to go to a branch in person to close my acct.. or I will still be charged a $5 maintenance fee..she also told me I would be charged a $35 fee if there's no money in the acct,on top of the$5.. needless to say when I hung up the phone I was very stressed & displeased..
I call the BBT on hwy72 in Madison AL.. I didn't need to say much of anything, the lady I spoke to was MORE than happy to help. INFACT, she told me the complete opposite from what this pelham branch told me.. that she could close it over the phone, easy! I just need to take my money out..&, she would keep an eye on my acct for me. THAT'S good customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Nathan. We appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your experiences. We take protecting your accounts very seriously. When notified of potential fraud on your debit card, the only way we can prevent future fraud occurrences is to close the card and order you a new one. With our MyCardRules App, you can take full control of your debit card which includes locking and unlocking it for purchases. Visit our website at peoplesbankal.com to learn more. If you have additional questions or need additional assistance, please feel free to contact our customer support team. They are available M-F 7:30 am to 5:30 pm and on Saturday from 8:00 am to 1:00 pm.

I unfortunately am looking into changing banks in the near future. Again I stress that it's not the bank or employees it's the extremely lackluster website and near useless debit card.

resp.text: Thanks so much for sharing your experience with us. We want you to feel comfortable sharing good or bad news with us. We are so sorry that your experience with us fell short of expectations. Feedback like yours led us to completely redo our website with a focus on improving user experience. Should you have additional comments or need assistance, please contact our customer support team at 877-788-0288. Thank you!

name: zachery barnes
text: Up until last week I would have given 5 stars as they have always been good to me. Then they drafted money from my account to pay a relatives loan without permission from anyone. When confronted lied saying that person authorized it when they didn't. Then refused to return the money back to my account as they said they had the legal authority to do it. Which according to realitives with extensive time in banking said it could only been done if I was on the loan which I wasn't. Finally after much back and forth between the parties involved they admitted they wasn't authorized or supposed to draft that money. To which they finally reversed the transaction but didn't reverse the entire amount. They kept 2 dollars for some reason. If you get a loan here or a relative does be prepared for some shady business practices.

name: Kary Nation
text:
I have been using Citizens Bank & Trust since 2002.  They have always gone out of their way to help me with any situation I have come across.  I have called them many times to ask questions, and was always helped immediately and with consideration.
Each of the tellers have become friends over the years.  My children were babies when we first became customers and they each took time to talk with my children and make them feel at home while I was in the bank.  They made them feel so at home that they had no trouble when it came time to open their own accounts.
I have made the comment before that if I were to move to another state I would still use Citizens Bank & Trust.  It is worth it to have someone who treats you like family.

The represenatative was smiling and laughing at me telling me no while I had tears streaming down my face not knowing how I was going to get back and forth to work and eat for the week or get my water back on at home. They dont care at all about the people that try they only care about money and I hope that people dont decide to bank with them and go ellsewhere becuase I have never ever been treated like they did.

name: Chase Deppen
text: If you are a business owner and you deposit more $5525.00, they will not honor your deposit or give you access to those funds for 10 days.  Upon opening my business account, I wrote a personal check from my personal account to help fund my business account.  The next day, I called my bank to make sure that they had sent the funds to BB&T.  My bank told me that BB&T had received the funds the next business day.  However, BB&T told me that while they had the funds from my personal account, my business account wouldn't be able to access those funds for over a week.  Initially, they claimed that this happened only because it was a new account.  However, when I made a second deposit and the same thing happened-- immediate access to $200 and the rest of the deposit would maybe be available in 7-10 days-- they then pointed me to the account agreement where it said that all deposits over $5525.00 would have a holding period of 7-10 days.  I totally understand that is their policy, I just want to warn any business owner that this bank is not interested in deposits and will treat you terribly when you question the policy.

name: Nicole Callaghan
text: This is a long one so get ready.... Let me tell you about this corporate office that doesn't know its a$# from its elbow.  I had a BBVA Compass Bank credit card and wanted to switch my name from my maiden name to my married name.  I called the phone # on the back of my credit card to inquire how to do that.  The customer service rep had to put me on hold because he didn't know what I needed to do.  He came back on the phone & gave me an address to mail a letter requesting the change & said to send proof of change with the letter.  So I wrote a letter, put in an official copy of my marriage certificate & a copy of my driver's license just as I have done for everything else to change my last name.  A month went by & nothing happened.  So I called to inquire where my new credit card was.  The customer service rep said that they didn't have anything in the computer about it.  When I asked if he could check where my documents were he kept repeating that they didn't have them.  We went in this circle for 20 minutes.  I became increasingly angry as he did not even attempt to help me.  This was alarming to me as my personal information with my husband's & my ss# was now out there somewhere, along with our address & my DL #.  I tracked my envelope w/ the post office & called them.  They assured me that my envelope was scanned into the correct PO Box & that Compass Bank picks up their mail everyday at the back door at 8:30 am.  I called Compass Bank back & told them what they told me & I once again got a, "We can't help you.  We don't have it.  If it is here it is safe with us."  This again happened over and over and over again.  I again became increasingly angry.  I cancelled my credit card at this point. (It was an emergency credit card that I barely used.)  At this point my aunt & I wrote letters to the Regional Manager, Branch Manager, & President/CEO of the company about this matter.  A woman named Tonya called me & pretended to care about my situation (after they got the letters).  She was very convincing on the phone that she cared.  However, after she promised to look into the matter I never heard from her for a week.  It took a few messages between myself and my aunt for her to return my phone call.  In fact, she did not return our phone calls until we said that we would write a letter to the Banking Commission or someone of that authority.  She told me someone from the Investigative team was supposed to call me & that she had put in 2 requests w/ them.  After that phone call, never heard from her again.  Then I received a phone call from a Customer Client Service rep named Holly.  She also seemed to pretend to care about my situation & told me that my letter ended up in another PO Box & went to a company called Computer Support Systems.  She stated that she called this company & that they said they received a letter for BBVA Compass Bank & that they were going to return it to the post office.  She even put me on a 3 way call with the post office to "confirm" this.  The whole time on the phone Holly was baiting the post office into saying or implying that they misplaced my envelope, that it was possible, that the other company didn't return etc, etc...  When the post office stated that this happens often w/ their bank Holly told her "to remember that there was a customer on the line."  This made me laugh to myself in disbelief.  I guess she thought I was stupid & that I didn't see what she was trying to do.  The post office took my phone # & said they would look into it further.  Holly seemed satisfied w/ her job & like she solved my problem.  The post office called me back a few hours later & told me just as they had the first time I spoke to them weeks earlier when I called them myself, that my envelope was scanned into the correct PO Box.  They also said that they get calls from Compass Bank customers all the time w/ the same problem.  STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!

text: Myself and many people I know have had really bad experiences with this particular bank at this particular location. So we point out that a person has to put numbers into the computer and no person is perfect and we offer to show them our records. They agree to look at them but the manager NEVER will meet with us. No matter how many times we go ,no matter how long we wait, it goes on and on. She is always too busy to see us if the bank owes us money.  That is Regions I know so many people who are thinking of leaving or have left. I left because of this branch's  manager and Region's policies about 4 years ago and gave up and lost money when I withdrew all my money. I recently found out that a close friend of mine is going through almost the same complaint with the exact same branch manager at this Regions branch whom she's been trying to talk to for a long time!!  She's short a lot of money in her account too. The assistant manager seemed very nice and wanted to help but he says only the branch manager has the power to handle such matters and he would tell me when to come to see her. But she wouldn't see me even after many months of coming in to see her!! I tried to complain to Regions Bank but I was told the decision must be made by the branch manager where I opened my account. If Possible I would give this branch and Regions Bank 0 Stars.

name: Sierra King
text: Haven’t ever had to deal with the pell city branch, I usually contact leeds or the one on 280 and they provide EXCEPTIONAL service and try and rectify all issues. The pell city location is awful. The assistant manager is horrifically rude. I called about THREE overdraft fees coming out of my account for ONE thing that overdrafted overnight before I got a chance to deposit cash. I called to find out why it took 3 out, totaling over $100. As soon as I said I had a question her response was “well I don’t understand what you want me to do I can see the same things as you can”. She continued to tell me my banking app was incorrect and I did not have money in my account and multiple pending transactions that “I could see” I have NEVER had issues seeing pending transactions or even with the money not coming out of my bank immediately for a “pending” transaction. She then told me the only accurate way to monitor how much money I have is to keep an “old fashioned check book”. I asked her again why I got charged THREE overdraft fees and she went through my account telling me all of the charges that still wouldn’t have led to me having three overdraft charges. She put me on hold 3 times in the middle of me talking and concluded the conversation by telling me she could only take one off, which I still haven’t seen the money back in my account, and that I would have to wait until her branch manager got back on Monday to resolve the issue and see if he could do anything for me at all, and that she would tell him I was “so distraught over the situation” in a super condescending tone. Absolutely disgraceful to handle business in this way in the middle of a pandemic where so many people are financially stretched. I wasn’t even fighting the first $36 charge, but the other two were absurd. Would not recommend this location, and it’s seriously making me reconsider banking with regions all together if this is how business will be conducted. I have been with them for 4 years and can understand mistakes when handled KINDLY and appropriately.

resp.text: Our apologies for the delay and your customer service experience. We appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns with us. We have forwarded your concerns to the appropriate channel. If you'd like to further discuss,  feel free to email us at askRegions@regions.com. -Trish

The manager is rude and uppity, and the customer service from everyone else follows suite. I have come twice and got treated like I was a nobody both times. Regions should really restaff this location. Or close it. It ruins the good name of the bank itself.

Now only if max bank would consider expanding their parking lot and all will be fine and dandy....💖💖💖💖

Bet they wouldn’t have any problem charging an overdraft fee. Any other reputable business waits until the line is cleared. This was on a Friday when people get paid. This bank should stay open later on Fridays at least.

The teller that did the transaction failed to mention this and tried to put blame on me for not telling her I need my money today. Would not recommend.

text: Very HELPFUL IN WHAT EVER I NEED

text: Every single time I visit this location I get fast, friendly service. Bev, Iesha, Megan, Rachel and Wes are great. They make me feel welcome every time.

text: I had a issue with my account and I went to 2 branches in the Huffman/Centerpoint area. My last stop was at the Centerpoint Branch, I spoke with the Brach Manager "Michelle Pippen". It was minutes before Mrs. Pippen was about to get off for the day. She assisted me with no rush to get to the issue. After trying to resolve this issue all day and being frustration, it was nice that finally someone wanted to help me resolve this issue. Thank you Mrs. Pippen. I really appreciated all of the help resolving this issue, that finally got resolved at the end of the day.

text: talked to james on the green line number very rude.disrespectful, and aggressive. Didnt help me at all. I'm really considering switching banks, Regions wont even help you protect your own money. If your considering regions you will be welcomed  with fees, horrible long customer service, and unprotected money.

text: We applied for a mortgage with Scott Nelson. It was a great experience! He is very quick to respond and provided world class service. text: Anniston, Oxford & the new Heflin branches have the most amazing, helpful employees!  Anything I have ever needed, from documents to new debit cards have been mine quickly, with a smile!

text: I have been banking with them for about 5 years now.

text: Worst banking experience ever, let my account get hacked random phone numbers without even notifying me, took over a month to get me my debit card, requires you to change your password every 6 weeks because their system isn't secure enough if you don't, changed my address to one that doesn't exist without notifying me, the list goes on and on and on. Just do yourself a favor if you are thinking about banking with noble and DON'T DO IT.

resp.text: Dylan, we apologize for any issues you are having if you could please contact us at 256-741-1800 and we can get to the bottom of the problem.

text: These people are unprofessional, uncourteous, and incredibly unhelpful. They act as though you are inconveniencing them by trying to get some banking done. Fees for this, fees for that. text: They get one star because even during Covid if your branch is open Customer Service should be your first priority. I went in to this branch at 1:40pm Monday, November 9th and wasn't done (waiting/opening a new account for a teenager & depositing the child's work check) until 2:48... Over an hour to open an account. Then while waiting on the so called teller tried to skip me to take a another lady he says was there before me (which I don't believe she was) he had now customer service and seem to have gotten a little frustrated with me for saying I was next. Luckily the branch manager Mr. Seale came immediately over to help, but it still took an hour to open that account. Thanks Mr. Seale, but this branch & maybe all the branches new but Customer service training & faster ways to service customers, no one should be sitting in a BANK over an hour.

Don't make the mistake I made! Avoid Wells Fargo, especially the Prattville branch, at all cost!

text: I made an attempt to open a local bank account since my other accounts as a military member are mostly online. This bank told me that they couldn’t get me in to see a banker for 2 weeks so I waited. I tried contacting the banker twice via email to ask what I needed to bring in only to get no response. Upon arrival, she says that I need my marriage certificate to add my wife. I run home and return with 20 minutes remaining to her next appointment. She tells me to make another appointment a week later!? The manager doesn’t care when I explain to him. Worst bank I have ever encountered, it’s almost like they don’t want additional customers. Take your business to a bank that actually understands the words customer service.

text: Seeing all the negative views, I thought I needed to share my experiences. I do not have an account as I use only credit unions, but I do submit deposits to my granddaughter's account. This is a business and I expect there to be long lines at time or delays due to unforeseen circumstances, there have been. But all communication has been to the point and courteous. Thank You (However, I do take note of Wells Fargo practices which have drawn controversy and governmental finds. They do affect my opinions of WF management and corporate operations, but I do not interact at that level.) .... NOTE: Some people just can't ever be satisfied.

name: Brandon Dobbs
text: Judging by the other reviews, seems I’m not the only one with issues here. This location also clearly doesn’t address issues as they seem to keep happening...I came in for a temporary replacement debit card, after I cancelled the lost one, and was told because of Covid, I’d have to wait “a while” is what I was quoted, by a manager who had no one in his office at the moment. I get only operating by appointments. I went to a different location in Montgomery and the manager there laughed after I told him about Prattville. Says, “for a temp debit card they said you have to wait?” Literally sat me down and in 3 minutes, I was out the door with a card. The Montgomery location apologized for the Prattville location and the incompetent manager up there...Find managers that know what they’re doing, or retrain the dork already there how to operate a branch more efficiently. Appointments make sense when it’s not something you can do in less than 5 mins and it keeps a mob from forming inside your building. You’d think with the RIDICULOUS Covid procedures, they’d want people in and out ASAP. Not sitting in the lobby waiting.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback on this location, Brandon. Although I'm glad to hear you were assisted at a different branch, I'm sorry you can't say the same about this location. Simple I will never go back to this bank I could have went to Walmart stand in the long line but at least I would have been informed better worst company ever

name: Scott Osborne
text: I've been banking with Wells Fargo for five years now. After reading these reviews, I'm not sure these people are aware or know where the Prattville branch is. I've had nothing but pleasant and helpful tellers every single time I go in. The one bad day/experience was after losing my debit card and license, they wouldn't allow me to withdraw money, even after producing alternate forms of ID. They let me use some standard of money, something like $50 to go get a new license. Unfortunately for me, it was late Friday. I was unable to access any funds until Monday. Recently however, this problem was addressed with the alternate pin for situations such as this.

name: Shana Cromwell
text: This is the worst. I get only 30 minutes for lunch. I have sat the whole time in drive-thru just to cash a check. Services that take longer than depositing and cashing of check should have one designated lane.

name: Steve Austin
text: Worst, most atrocious Banking Services I have ever experienced!  I have Banked with Wells Fargo recently for the first time from the Southeast to the Southwest.  Post the employee skimming scandal and Wells Fargo firing 5,300 employees the Company acts Bipolar.  They have burned my phone up after any transactions per surveys worrying the mess out of me with calls and voice mails.  Then unbeknowst to me my account was locked down, I could not receive money nor take any out,  I still do not know what caused that.  Its very Passive-Aggressive behavior.  I spent an hour at a Branch last week after which time I thought the matter was resolved yet I am still having problems.  As I saw one Google  Review say and I agree, run do not walk away from any Wells Fargo Branch.  I have a Friend that got burned by them on a mortgage as well.

name: Lauryn G
text: Do not go to this branch if you can help it. I went today around 1pm for the first time and it will be my last unless I'm stopping by the ATM (and therefore don't have to interact with their employees). The customer service was lackluster and, in fact, very rude. The personal banker we spoke to told us a direct lie that all other wells fargo representatives (from corporate and a Montgomery branch) told us was wildly incorrect. After working with Wells Fargo for 2 years, this was the first time I've come across a rude and disrespectful employee. It appears I wasn't the first to feel the same way here.

text: This is literally the worst branch for customer service I have ever been to. I have yet to encounter anyone nice here. They all look like they hate their lives. I wish there was another branch here

name: Robby Anderson
text: I really wish that I could give negative stars on this review.  I've never encountered such manipulative and deceiving people in my life. I'm in the process of closing my accounts as quickly as possible.

name: My brothers Keeper
text: I dont have a wells Fargo account but ive been going to this branch for about 4 years and putting money in my mother in laws account who lives in georgia. The people there are always nice and helpful, but as of this week, I am no longer allowed to walk in with cash (legal tender for all debts public and private) because apparently the $40 ive been putting into her account every week is suspicious. I know they have a need to cut down on criminal transactions but 1) Its forty dollars and 2) ive been doing this for years and neither me or my 80 year old mother in law have been indicted for putting cash in or taking cash out of a bank ( the place you go when you need to give or receive money). When my wife told her mother that I didn't get the money put in, the poor woman acted like she was going to have to eat cat food all week. So thanks wells Fargo, I had to feel bad about making a old lady cry, but at least they are assured that my $40 isn't going to fund ISIS

name: Blake Hardy
text:
Asked if I could do a currency exchange from dollars to euros and the bank manager asked me if I was and I quote.

"Are you leaving town or something?"

name: Kandace Ballard
text:
I lost my Regions debit card about 4 days ago; after looking everywhere, I finally gave in to reporting it as lost/stolen. The website read that I'd receive it within 5-7 business days, which I was okay with, but my biggest concern was when I read that it was being mailed to an old address I had connected to the card; which is a very, VERY bad neighborhood. So around 11pm I called customer service, and they were able to cancel the request (thank God,) and stated I needed to go to my local Regions branch to change the address and request new, so I did.

The wait was a little longer than expected, but I'm not one to complain. I typically do not leave reviews, but the woman who assisted me, Roxie Kitchen, was phenomenal and deserves the recognition! She not only helped me update my address and request me a new card, but she also assisted me with setting up a savings account, and gave me several options to help me build up my credit score, since I am looking to purchase my (first) own vehicle by the end of the year and I currently have no credit.

We had some complications, but despite it all she kept a positive attitude and was very helpful, informative and sweet; it was just like talking to a friend. She welcomed every question I had and was able to give me a clear answer and explain in detail what everything was.

If you live in Troy, or just passing by in need of a visit, definitely stop by and talk to Mrs. Roxie. It was a great experience!

name: John Calvin
text:
Worst banking experience due to management.

I went to this particular Regions bank today simply to pay a bill.  When i got there cars were lined up by about 5-7 in each row so i decided to go inside. It took more than 30 minutes to get to the front to pay my bill.  They literally had one inside teller, and one outside teller, on Labor day weekend.   As i moved up the line i looked back and saw that the line stretched to the outside door and customers were getting impatient.  I assume this is the way the outside car lines were as well.

I can understand it being a busy day due to circumstances.  I can't understand they only having 2 total tellers (1 inside, and one outside teller) on a day such as this, other than poor management.

This was wrong for both the employees (whom i feel sorry for), and the customers.

At other Regions bank locations i have had a good experience.  This one i would rather never go back.

text:
This is the best regions in the city. They are so friendly, remember me when I come in, and have wonderful customer service.

I know times are crazy right now, and sometimes things take longer than normal - but they are super apologetic and get you in and out as fast as they can.

name: Amanda Saenz
text: This is the slowest bank I have ever been too.  My employer banks here and we have to make commercial deposits.  We stopped going to this location and went to the other lakeshore branch due to sometimes being there 45 minutes getting the deposits done.  Unfortunately for some insane reason Regions closed the other Lakeshore branch and we are back to having to go to this one now.  Today we go to make 7 deposits we get up to the tube and are told to drive to lane that is closed and wait while they do the deposits.  Keep in mind you still can’t go into the building so drive thru is our only option to taking care of our business.  While waiting for the deposits to get done 7 cars went thru and got taken care of.  Then they tell me over the speaker to get back into an open lane and wait behind the 3 cars to receive my receipts and money bag.  I couldn’t get from the lane I was parked in that they told me to go to because that one is broke.  I made them bring it to me out front because I was waiting in the line.  I have contacted my corporate office and we are in the process of changing banks now because this is not how you treat customers.  I shouldn’t of been made to go through hoops to give you our businesses money!

name: Robert Evans
text: I bank at BBVA Compass but had to deposit a check for a friend here.  So glad I do not bank there.

Because he couldn’t Man the door and do it safely at the same time! Seriously?? I was the only guest in the bank!

text: Bring a counterfeit pen if you're planning on taking cash out of this location. They gave us a fake $50 bill. They had no way of knowing that they were the source. This was fine and what we expected. The part that I'm not okay with is the teller, Natalie, actually encouraging me to use it elsewhere which is illegal. She was the same teller who gave us the fake currency originally. It was inappropriate to say the least.

name: Rus Hardy
text: I was out of town and had a major accident leaving me hospitalized.   My id and Bankcard were damaged in the accident.  My other bank (not any more!) Refused to help in any way.  When I called Wells Fargo they were courteous and very helpful.  The gentleman asked me a number of security questions and within 10 minutes I had the funds i needed in my hand.  I was 1000 miles from home stranded, very injured, and hospitalized.   Where my former bank said no at every turn...Wells Fargo helped without hesitation.  Amazing!!

I don't do business with businesses who use telemarketing.

text: After banking with this bank over decades of name changes I politely asked to use the restroom.They said they could not let me use the bathroom it was not for public use. Like the motto says real service.

name: Meloni Hinson
text: I went to close both of my accounts on 7/21 because of ridiculous fees, the latest being a fee for NOT using my account enough. So you get fees for using it TOO much and not ENOUGH apparently. I supposedly closed both accounts, had to go back and withdraw a penny after withdrawing all funds for "interest" and then got paperwork from an account manager saying my accounts were closed. Then one month later I get another email saying that my account is $12 in the negative AGAIN for not using the account enough. Apparently the account manager wanted to try to squeeze out another fee without me realizing it! Do NOT go to Wells Fargo to open an account. As we've seen from the multiple news stories, Wells Fargo likes to rip off their customers with their shady business practices. America's First Credit Union is right down the road, go there instead!

Tellers made it cumbersome and difficult for my employees to cash their payroll checks (a BB&T check with ID at their branch).  When another bank I use made it easy for them to cash their (BB&T, a competitor’s) checks I wrote them from my BB&T account, I moved my account elsewhere. I can understand why they had to close their Dothan branch.

Their online banking was easy to use and robust but the local service couldn’t be much worse.

I even have an online account for the car loan...if they were so worried about security etc wouldn't they send the info i need via their online app?  Guess not...rather be difficult than helpful.  Thats ok though... i see how they gonna be.

Imagine how hard it must be to cash a check if it's this hard to make a deposit. Ridiculous!

name: Jonathan Ford
text: This is the worst managed branch in North Alabama. The staff is completely incompetent on products, assisting and being approachable. The manager Christy is way over her head in dealing with this small branch. The staff has turned over nearly 100% in less than 4 months and the blonde on the left as you walk in is zero help so don’t even ask. I’ve stopped going here and finally decided to write a review.  There used to be man here that was helpful and polite but even he is gone. I think I’ll even stop using BBVA and go with a company that is competent in areas dealing with customers and banking products.

name: Kim M
text: I came in to load my clear spend card waited in line it took forever. I then stepped up to the teller line not recognizing any of them there. But I gave the teller my card and asked to load $500.00. She then said my card wasn;t in the system. I then asked for the older red hair lady or that handsome young man they were always helpful. The girl said they no longer work there. So I went to the office with the blonde hair lady. I asked her to help me load my clear spend card. She then said I am better off opening a checking account. I told her the card was really for my son whose doing travel basball and he's 13 and this is easier to manage. She then said she couldn't help me and that's something the tellers would have to do.She tried really hard to sale me a credit card or an account when I just needed to load money. I then tried to go to the manager but she closed her door and I knocked and she said she could't help me that she's on a call. I use to come to this branch when I lived close by and this use to be a great branch. But it looks like the turnover is high the new staff of tellers don't know what there doing. Also the ladies in the front offices won't help. My son was needing the card the next day and I had no time so I went to walmart and purchased a prepaid visa which allowd me to track expenses from there app to my phone. I will never come back to this banch ever again. Sadly I was in town and this was the closest branch worst banking experience ever.

text: Will be closing account and moving it to another brand. Went to bank to draw out money to make a road trip. The atm didn’t work, I proceeded to go to drive thru, when a banker looked at me and another vehicle pulling up and quickly dropped cones to block us out and said we closed 30 seconds ago! No respect for the very people in their community who provide them with a job by trusting them to hold our money. To act as a communist company by dictating when we can get money by the second. Where is compassion, doing the right thing, helping your community gone? I’m a disabled combat veteran, what if I said , it’s 4 o’clock we stop fighting for your freedom till 9am go defend yourself till then! That’s exactly what she said to customers! That incident made me have to beg for a room in this town for a night till they opened the next day! I slept in my car because of her, I hope she slept well and had a nice meal!!!

I was having a very, very bad day. When I got there I realized I left my military ID an hour away where I'm staying. I had no gas, no money, and no ID so I was understandably very stressed when they told me I needed my ID to get a replacement.
The manager of the bank made an exception though, and was the kindest lady I have ever met in my entire life. She very quickly helped me out and I now have a new card. The service is incredible and I'm very thankful.

text: If you do any mobile banking, go elsewhere. They continually "update" their system which then blocks your access to the app. The only way to regain access is to go through customer service. Stay on hold there for 10 minutes, a recording tells you your call is important and your estimated wait time is 8 minutes 59 seconds. Ten minutes later, the same message about your call being important comes on, but now your wait time is 8 minutes 55 seconds. Seriously, go to Alabama Credit Union. At least their stuff works and they know how to answer a phone.
