text: I came by the drive through to deposit a check. It was made out to my spouse and me. I was the only one who signed as I did not know we both needed to sign. I feel that the tellers could have been more courteous in explaining to me why they could not cash the check.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience at this location, Jennie. I'm disappointed to hear you were spoken to in this way and would like to address it as quickly as possible. Please tell me more about what happened in an email to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com, and be sure to mention your full name, Google username, phone number, and address (no account numbers). I look forward to hearing from you. -Jessica, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: David Missildine
text:
I first went to the ATM outside as I am handicapped and this is the easiest option for me. The atm was out of order, therefore I had to go inside to do my business. I walked up to the waiting spot as both tellers were occupied. The one teller had finished her business with the customer and was having a casual chat
I was ok with this as customer service is important.  After this customer left, I approached the window as the girl said to me 'give me a minute "
At this time she turned to the girl behind her and started a casual conversation with her. I felt ignored and disrespectful. I will never be back to this branch.

resp.text: I'm sorry to learn about your experience at this location, David. Could you email me with more details about your interaction with the team member you mentioned? Please address it to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com. Be sure to include your full name, phone number, address, and review as well (no account numbers). I'll make sure your visit is reviewed by the appropriate team. -Jessica, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Phillip Malbrough
text:
The ATM is almost always broken or out of service, or just doesn't have any cash in it.

I had used Capitol One Bank for a really long time, but after traveling a bit, I noticed that Capitol One was a smaller regional thing, and Wells Fargo was more available and widely used, at least in the areas I had been traveling to. But since I've arrived in Decatur, there was only this location where you could go inside to  talk with representatives, and two other locations that were just ATM'S. One of those had been removed, so now there's really only one Wells Fargo ATM in all of Decatur... And it's not at this bank..

resp.text: Thanks for bringing this to our attention, Phillip. I apologize for the inconvenience and have forwarded your feedback about the ATM at this branch appropriately. Should you have additional concerns please email more details to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com and mention your review and Google username (no account numbers). -Janet, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: Opening an account at this location was a mistake, stay as far away as you can. I try to only leave positive reviews for places I enjoy, but after a terrible experience time after time, it needs to be mentioned that you will not enjoy your your experience here and you need to look elsewhere for your banking needs.

resp.text: I’m sorry you continue to experience difficulties at this location, and I want to be sure these concerns are addressed. text:
Jack Norris is the best Banker in Wells Fargo. If i could give more then 5 stars I would. I had some major issues trying to open an account. Jack went above and beyond to help me get the accounts after i kept getting the runaround from Wells Fargo Corp.  5 trips to his branch (which is an hour drive 1 way. so normally this was 3-3 1/2 hour thing for me) and 4 of the times the "back office" saying I needed to do this first. so i would do it. then i would need to do something else the next time. on and on. Jack never gave up and fought on my behalf. After going to the bank today again for the 5th time and Jack calling their "back office to see why i still could not open an account the day ended at 5:15pm and we opened an account!
thank you Jack for everything!

resp.text: I'm very pleased to hear that Jack was able to assist you with opening an account, Allie. However, I’m sorry to hear about your overall experience with us at this location. To ensure I can forward your concerns appropriately, please mention your review and Google username in an email to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com (no account numbers). Thanks so much for your feedback. -Nick, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Chuck
text:
PNC Bank I like the features they offer.  I really like when I use my credit card or ATM card I get a text in seconds. Also,  my credit card number got stolen and they only charged $0.02 in CA and then they tried to use it in GA at 2 Redbox location and Wal-Mart and they declined it. I was called by PNC in minutes to ask if the was me,  I told them No I am at my house in Alabama. The lady was really sweet got the card shut down and a replacement in the mail in days.
They call every 3 months and make sure that I am happy with the service. They ask if would like to come see if they have any new needs. The new credit card I like I atleast get 1% on everything up to 4% on things. I would recommend this bank to anyone.

text: The staff at this bank is ALWAYS friendly, patient and helpful. I absolutely enjoy my visit here each week. They are almost like family. ❤

text:
I’ve banked with Regions for well over a decade in MO and this branch is a joke! Unorganized, unhelpful and incompetent.
Went in to get a proof of funds for a home purchase, the woman said she would email it to me. Never received it. Called back and the woman on the phone assured me it was being emailed by closing yesterday.
Had to go back this morning and it still hadn’t been taken care of. I sat and waited until Rhonda could get a one sentence letter completed.
If I need anything else, I’ll call my MO branch and have them take care of it. Very disappointing level of service from beginning to end.

I must say that both gentlemen were extremely helpful, courteous and everything I would look for in a representative from any company.  Dealing with them was a pure pleasure. text: I've been banking with regions Bank through my business and personal accounts for 15 years.  Today may have been the last straw, I was driving up to the drive-thru and was about three car lengths away when they turn the sign over to closed and when I pulled up a second later they just ignored me. This was on a Friday afternoon at 5 last business day of the month. Why are banks closing at 5 on a Friday now? Don't even get me started on Saturdays. I don't know how many times I've done a transaction through the drive-thru, and not even heard a hello goodbye or thank you or my name. I think I'll be going to a bank that's a little more hometown.

name: Whitney Mixon
text:
Update:
After that unfortunate experience I started going to the Gulf Shores location. They're pretty great out there. Anyway, a couple months ago I attempted the Foley PNC (only because it's a lot closer than GS) and what a change! Although, there's usually only one or two employee(s) working the window and/or counter, but they're super friendly and always acknowledge me when they're busy. Makes me want to continue going to this branch.

Original post:
Pulled up to the drive through today about 1:45 pm and I was the only one there. I saw two girls working behind the computers at the window. I assumed they were busy dealing with other customers. Cool, I'll wait. What's not cool? Neither of them even acknowledged I was there. I work in customer service and if I'm busy I'll at least say "I'll be with you in a moment." Most people are okay with that, I'm okay with that. Alas, I didn't get that from them. I sat there probably close to five minutes. Another car had pulled into the slot to my right about four minutes after me and sent in the container. She wasn't waiting very long before the lady with the name plate where the first letter was a J grabbed her container, then finally made eye contact with me and dispensed the drawer for me to put my money into for my car payment. Imagine my frustration when she acknowledged this woman that pulled up about four minutes after me. I let J proceed with the other customer, but when she went to put in my payment I just had to know why. I mean, you'd be curious too, right? Her reason was it isn't personal, but she didn't see me sitting behind the gigantic window that's directly in front of her face. Yes, she was behind a computer, but several times she moved from behind it to place some receipts into the bin underneath where the containers come in. You can't be that oblivious when there's a window there. Unless.. dare I say it? You choose to be. It was quite amusing for her to think I would believe that horrible excuse. If your employees are that unaware of your customers, as J stated, then maybe they should be retrained a little better. To have employees that have such poor customer service skills looks bad on the company as a whole.

name: william dooley

text: I was charged for 4 years for a safety deposit box that was an additional service benefit because I had Performance Select Checking. I only realized this because they raised the price from $40 to $80 a year and I went in and questioned them. It has been over 2 weeks and no one has gotten back with me regarding my $120 refund. If they did this to me, how many hundreds of customers are being billed for a free safety deposit box??? Two weeks ago I ordered euros at the Gulf Shores PNC and still no euros. PNC is not the bank RBC or First Gulf was years ago.

name: Ashley Duggan
text: This was a great bank. I loved all the people, I loved how local it was. I loved how my account actually worked, and how quickly transactions would go through. But I overdrafted so many times, because I was unable to sign in online to check my balance. It would automatically reset my password and lock my account every 60 days, just as a regular security measure. And I really appreciate the extra security, but it became overbearing. If I ever got a new phone, or logged in using a browser, it would always tell me, (even though I knew my username and password!) it would tell me I had to answer all kinds of security questions and have a phone calls and texts sent to my phone number. I was okay with it at first, but once I had to call Cheaha and speak to someone to fix my account, what felt like once a week, I gave up and just decided I needed to go to a bank where I could actually check my account balance when I needed to. Sometimes, I would even have to wait over the weekend before I could speak to someone to get my account unlocked.

Our cell phones ended up being disconnected for a whole day because we were not able to make the payment due to this, we're new in town and rely on our GPS in our phones to navigate us around town, extremely inconvenient!! My husand and I work 6-7 days a week during the day, we are hoping to have a chance to switch banks soon! I honestly do not feel comfortable banking with this bank, Ive had a bank account since i was 17, for the past 13 years and have never gone through anything like this!!

text: This USED to be a great bank when it was Charter. The online banking "app" is so outdated it looks like someone made it from a Nextel phone. My balance is never correct, transactions pend for almost a week and when you deposit a check, funds are no longer immediately available.

name: Geordi La Forge
text: WARNING:  My account was hacked at CenterState. Someone got in and changed my security questions.  CenterState (FL Headquarters) tried to blame it on me.  But I work in the computer field and keep virus, malware and spyware scanners running on all my devices.  I never check online banking on an unsecure network.  My devices use either a fingerprint or face ID to login so I can't be tracked by keystrokes.  I have reported them to the Federal Reserve and hopefully the truth will come out about the security breach that has occurred.  RUN AWAY FROM THIS BANK.

name: 9ein lives
text:
I'm very disappointed in what this bank turned into. Centerstate has ruined the amazing buisiness that was Charter. Setting aside the nightmare that was the transition, it now seems like everything good that Charter had is gone.

1. The app is like dealing with dial-up and you have to log back in if you hit the back button.
2.  Direct deposits take too long to clear.
3.  Transfers from/to your own accounts have to be scheduled if its after 10 p.m. ( and as of a day later it still hasn't cleared)

text: You won't find a more friendly and helpful bank than First Southern!

name: Cnh Cbb
text: 3 years ago I was referred to a banker at First Southern when buying a home. She was an excellent mortgage officer & did a wonderful job. This past summer I began the process of opening my own small business. Because I had once had a great experience with her, I went back to this mortgage officer & allowed her to help me set up my business checking account. I was talked into using their "Merchant Services" for my credit/debit card transaction needs & I meet up with their merchant services rep Jarred. He is awful. My card reader never worked properly from day 1 & he continued to tell me he'd have me a new one. Days later it stopped allowing me to email receipts to my customers. After 3 months of him constantly avoiding my messages and phone calls about my reader problems (and me paying more money to TYPE my transactions because my SWIPE never worked) I was charged a ridiculous $40 fee that he and NOBODY at the bank could tell me what the fee was exactly. I finally was able to get him to answer my call & I canceled my Merchant Services. The next month (month 4) comes along and I was charged the $40 fee AGAIN!!!! I closed my account immediately & I then took my money to another bank (SUNTRUST) and was told by the people at SUNTRUST about a survey that i had to take to avoid First Southerns unknown fee. (Why first southern & Jarred never mentioned this survery to me remains unknown.) But Suntrust advised me to check my spam folder.. and there they were! Also, I closed my account last week & I received another email in my spam folder just yesterday about receiving ANOTHER fee because of unanswered survey. And I can't even click on the survey now because my account is closed!! First Southern completely let me down with their customer service. They continue to explain how the merchant service is a "third party" Yes but its YOUR CHOOSEN third party & as the FIRST PARTY you should take responsibility for all parties involved. OPENING THAT ACCOUNT HAS TURNED INTO NOTHING BUT A HEADACHE. WORST DECISION I HAVE MADE IN QUITE SOMETIME. And here's to hoping this unknown "fee" doesnt go to collections and effect my credit. Guess i'll be calling the 1-800 number first thing in the morning trying to get some answers. Will never ever go back to this bank for anything ever again. No help with anything & kept in the dark the entire time. Its sad that the new bank has obviously heard about what first southern has been doing because they knew right away what had happened to me!! Talk about screwing over numerous customers. Awful. Just awful.

text:
I left my purse at home and needed to get cash since I was over 30 minutes away and didn't have time to drive back to get it. I went to this bank and luckily I had my check book in my car but the lady in the drive thru didn't seem to really care and said you have to have a photo I.D no matter what.

I shamefully did this before a few years ago and they just asked me my personal Information and made me sign a paper so that way I could get cash taken out. I told her I would go to the other regions where someone would be nice enough to help me. I went to the regions on hill crest and she was the exact opposite of the lady I talked to at this bank. I was able to get money out after telling her all of my personal info.

I understand it's to be safe but when someone knows all of their information by heart and can even pull up their account on their phone and tell them how much is in their account, I feel like there needs to be exceptions. Bad customer service.

text: The drive thru only is open on saturday , and they wont even cash their own customers checks thru the drive thru window if the receiver/(person cashing checks) , uhh isnt that kinda how check cashing and writing works , THE PERSON THAT WRITES THE CHECK OWES SOMEONE , THEREFORE,  THE BANK THE CHECK IS WRITTEN ON OWES THAT SAME PERSON ,REGARDLESS OF THEM being their customer , what if i was looking for a great bank to put my vast fortune in but wanted my bank to pay my debts thru their local branch on saturdays , Also what if im looking for a bank as a potential  customer , and I am trying to cash a check written to me by someone that is already a customer of regions and I try to cash the check this customer has written to me , and I am in serious , desperate need of the cash on that day , which is saturday , before 12:00pm  , and your open , but deny- said potential customer of cashing -said check written  by the - said existing regions customer , because that potential  customer isnt a customer  already , its un professional , and horrible business practice!
